observation: Engine running rough above 3000 ft, slight vibration noted.
Oil pressure gauge fluctuating just below green arc.
Carburetor icing suspected, carb heat applied, engine RPM restored.
GPS unit lost satellite lock for approximately 2 minutes in flight.
Unforecasted low cloud layer forced deviation to alternate airport.
Radio communication became intermittent, squelch issue suspected.
Stall warning horn activated intermittently during steep turn practice.
Crosswind on final approach exceeded student pilot's demonstrated ability.
Landing ballooned, followed by a hard landing, no visible damage.
Bird strike on the right wing leading edge, minor dent found.
Student confused runway numbers during pattern work at unfamiliar field.
High CHT on cylinder #3 during extended climb.
Left brake felt soft during taxi after landing.
Airspeed indicator reading seemed low compared to GPS ground speed.
Fuel smell in cockpit, traced to poorly sealed fuel cap on left wing.
Unexpected turbulence from a passing helicopter's wake.
Difficulty starting engine when hot, suspected vapor lock.
Passenger experienced airsickness during maneuvers.
VOR needle oscillating, unable to get reliable bearing.
Realized POH was not in the aircraft after takeoff, returned to land.
